comment.author: 26375439@N03
comment._content:
An Egyptian Scarab, possibly a pendant, with a distinctive boat design on the right.  There are four people on the boat, two in a tent or enclosure with royal-looking headgear, and two attendants outside on the boat, and maybe a cat(?) at the front.

The two hieroglyphic inscriptions on the 'wing covers' (left) are encircled, which means they are peoples' names, and should be translatable by an expert.

comment.author: 7839660@N02
comment._content: The cartouches on this scarab contain the names of king Rameses II of the 19th dynasty.
